page.title: 09Dairy Farming in the Dale
page.content: Many farmers keep a dairy herd. In winter they are kept in cubicles. In summer they graze in the pastures. One farmer milks 12 cows. They are milked twice a day and on average give 3 gallons of milk a day. The cows are milked in either a byre or milking parlour.{Electric machines}are used. The cows are fed cow cake and they start to let-down the milk when they hear the rattle of the bucket.The teat-cups or clusters guide the milk into a unit.The milk then goes into a stainless steel sterilized milk tank. This has a milk cooler with a thermometer to ensure the correct temperature. The milk goes to the {milk marketing board.} A tanker which holds 2,000 gallons takes the milk and transfers it to a tanker which holds 6,000 gallons the tanker takes the milk to the dairy in Northallerton.
